Key Match Events: Australia avoid a third straight defeat to begin the World Cup.
Sri Lanka started really well but were bowled out for 210.
Adam Zampa picked up four wickets, his best bowling at a World Cup, and claimed the Player of the Match award.
A six back over Wellalage’s head by Stoinis secured the win for Australia.
Sri Lanka's openers had a strong partnership of 125 for the first wicket but collapsed to 205 all out from 157-2.
Inglis scored a fine 58 before getting out.
Post-Match Reflections: Captain Pat Cummins was delighted with the performance and said his side were never going to let the pressure get to them.
Cummins highlighted the team's high standards and great energy in the field.
Kusal Mendis, the new captain of Sri Lanka, acknowledged the team's risky shots and lack of strike rotation.
Mendis expressed confidence in the batting unit to perform better in the remaining matches.
Adam Zampa mentioned dealing with a back spasm but was pleased to be on the right end of the result.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Australia now face Pakistan in Bangalore on Friday while Sri Lanka remain in Lucknow where they’ll face the Netherlands on Saturday.
Sri Lanka needs six straight wins to stay in contention.
Australia's early loss of Warner and Smith was a concern, but they managed to steady their nerves and secure the win.
